resources.string: Please add a key before adding a wallet.
Looks like you have added a key
NFC, air-gapped and software keys are supported.
Do you want to add a Bitcoin wallet?
No active slot is detected. Do you want to set up a new slot?
This wizard will walk you through creating an assisted wallet step by step.
Thinking about setting up an inheritance plan?
TAPSIGNER is a wireless NFC smart card that will sign transactions with a simple tap on your phone.
Please register this wallet with your air-gapped device
You must register this wallet with your air-gapped device before you can use it to sign transactions.\n\nPlease do so by scanning the QR code on the next screen using your device.
The inheritance can be claimed directly by the Beneficiary or indirectly through a third-party Trustee.
The inheritance plan will have these main components:
We will now go through them one-by-one.

In your wallet, you have designated a TAPSIGNER to be the inheritance key. An encrypted backup of this key is stored on the server.

On or after the Activation Date, the Beneficiary or Trustee can recover this key using the Backup Password printed on the back of the TAPSIGNER.

[B]Make note of this Backup Password[/B]. You will need to share it with the Beneficiary or Trustee.

In your wallet, you have designated two TAPSIGNERs to be the inheritance keys. The encrypted backups of these keys are stored on the server.

On or after the Activation Date, the Beneficiary or Trustee can recover these keys using the Backup Passwords printed on the back of the TAPSIGNERs.

[B]Make note of the two Backup Passwords[/B]. You will need to share them with the Beneficiary or Trustee.
[B]Beneficiary[/B]: an individual who will inherit your bitcoins.\n\n[B]Trustee[/B]: an individual who will help manage and distribute your bitcoins to the Beneficiary.
Here is your plan’s Magic Phrase
To authorize the inheritance planning request

%1$s, you will be asked to sign a dummy transaction that sends 10,000 sat (%2$s) to your own wallet%3$s.\n\n[B]The dummy transaction uses a fake input and does not move any of your real bitcoins. It will not be broadcast and will be immediately removed afterwards.[/B]
. Since more than one signature is required, other keyholders will also be notified
All Bitcoin features work exactly the same on testnet as they would on the real blockchain. See if an assisted wallet is a good fit for you by trying it out on testnet.
The testnet is an alternative Bitcoin blockchain used for testing. Testnet coins are separate and distinct from actual bitcoins and they do not hold any value.
You can bypass the spending limit by signing transactions using two of your own keys.

To use Ledger with your assisted wallet, you will need the desktop app. If you don’t have it yet, please [A]download it here[/A].\n\nOnce the app is installed, sign in to your account on desktop, then click Continue below.

To use Trezor with your assisted wallet, you will need the desktop app. If you don’t have it yet, please [A]download it here[/A].\n\nOnce the app is installed, sign in to your account on desktop, then click Continue below.

To add COLDCARD via a USB cable, you will need the desktop app. If you don’t have it yet, please [A]download it here[/A].\n\nOnce the app is installed, sign in to your account on desktop, then click Continue below.

To use BitBox with your assisted wallet, you will need the desktop app. If you don’t have it yet, please [A]download it here[/A].\n\nOnce the app is installed, sign in to your account on desktop, then click Continue below.
You can now add %1$s using the desktop app. Once finished, you can return here to continue the setup.
No %1$s devices have been detected. Please try again.
A Nunchuk group wallet is a multisig wallet where multiple people share control of the funds. Keys can be distributed among the master account and a secondary account, or secondary accounts.

On one hand, having multiple people involved in a wallet means that the burden of key management can be shared. The keys are also more likely to be well distributed.

On the other hand, individual members’ skill levels and experience might vary.

For best security, please make sure that all group members understand the basics of key management and how to secure their own keys.
A master account and secondary account(s) control three keys; Nunchuk holds the fourth key on a secure server to assist in inheritance planning and daily wallet operation.
A master account and secondary account(s) control three keys; Nunchuk does not control any keys.
A master account and secondary account(s) control five keys; Nunchuk does not control any keys.
What type of group wallet do you want to create?
What is your preferred method for setting up this group wallet?
Single-person setup: the master account creates the wallet then distributes key(s) to group members.
Distributed setup: the group members hold key(s) from the start and partipate in the creation of the wallet.
Only use a single-person setup if all members in the group are able to trust the master account to handle keys on their behalf.\t\t\t
Apply the same limit to all members
Enter the members’ emails and roles. You can have up to 3 keyholders (including the master account) and an unlimited number of observers.
Enter the members’ emails and roles. You can have up to 4 keyholders (including the master account) and an unlimited number of observers.
Enter the members’ emails and roles. You can have up to 5 keyholders (including the master account) and an unlimited number of observers.

Can make changes to inheritance planning and wallet policies.
Can add or remove group members.
Can edit transaction notes, create coin tags or collections.
Can create and sign transactions.
Can view wallet transactions.
Can participate in group chat.
Can create and sign transactions.\nCan view wallet transactions.\nCan participate in group chat.
Can view wallet transactions, but no signing privileges.\nCan participate in group chat.

If each keyholder holds their own key, all members will have equal rights in the wallet. At any point in time, two of the keyholders can withdraw all bitcoins without the remaining person’s permission.\nAre you sure you want this setup?
The admin account will have the ability to add and remove members and to propose changes to the inheritance plan and wallet policies. Please make sure that it is someone that you can trust.
The admin account will have the ability to add and remove members and to propose changes to the wallet policies. Please make sure that it is someone that you can trust.
An admin must have an email-based account.
Please make sure that you have no more than %1$s keyholders.
This member is currently in charge of the inheritance plan for this wallet. Please cancel the plan first.

Your new wallet will be a 2-of-4 multisig wallet. [B]Two keys are always required for spending[/B].

Among your three keys, select one key to be the inheritance key. It must be a TAPSIGNER.

Pull to refresh the key statuses.
Your new wallet will be a 2-of-4 multisig wallet. [B]Two keys are always required for spending[/B].\n\nPull to refresh the key statuses.
Your new wallet will be a 2-of-3 multisig wallet. [B]Two keys are always required for spending[/B].\n\nPull to refresh the key statuses.
Your new wallet will be a 3-of-5 multisig wallet. [B]Three keys are always required for spending[/B].\n\nPull to refresh the key statuses.

Your new wallet will be a 3-of-5 multisig wallet. [B]Three keys are always required for spending[/B].

Among your keys, select two keys to be the inheritance keys. They must be TAPSIGNERs.

Pull to refresh the key statuses.
%s invited you to join a group wallet.
Are you sure you want to deny this wallet invitation?
%s initiated a group wallet. If you’re part of this wallet, please add your key.
We’ve sent a code to [B]%1$s[/B]. Please enter it below.
Only applicable for members who own a TAPSIGNER, Ledger, Trezor, or Software key.
You’ve run out of %1$s wallets. To purchase additional %1$s wallets, please visit nunchuk.io/my-plan.
Platform key co-signing will be activated once all keyholders have approved the spending limit(s).
Please wait for the Master account to continue wallet creation.
The keyholders have been notified of the health check request. Once the request is completed, the health status will be updated in the group dashboard.
The inheritance plan has been created
The inheritance plan has been updated
Are you sure you want to cancel this health check request?
Are you sure you want to cancel this change?
Are you sure you want to deny this inheritance planning request?
Once enough keys have been added, the master or admin account can finish the setup.
Currently, TAPSIGNER, Ledger and Trezor are compatible with the Keyholder (limited) role.
Please claim your key by performing a key health check. Select your key and continue.
To access the wallet configuration file or export it to your device later, navigate to the wallet → View wallet config → More menu → Export wallet configuration.
Are you sure you are done claiming? To claim a key later, you can manually perform a health check on that key.
This is a wired key, please claim this key using the desktop app.

By default, group chat messages are kept for 30 days.\n\nTo change how long messages are kept, please navigate to the wallet dashboard → More menu → Manage group chat history (admin privileges required).
Looks like the health check has failed. Note that you might need to register the wallet with the device before it can be used to sign transactions.\n\nWhat would you like to do?
. Please use the key that you want to health check to sign
Services are currently not available for observers.
[A]%1$s[/A] is requesting to set up the inheritance plan for [B]%2$s[/B].\n\n[C]Note that the person in charge of the plan will be able to access sensitive data that unlocks the inheritance.[/C]

%1$s is requesting to add a recurring payment named %2$s.

A recurring payment allows you to automatically create transactions that send bitcoins to a predefined destination wallet or addresses at scheduled intervals.

[A]The recurring payment needs to be approved by all keyholders in the group wallet, and can be canceled by any keyholder at any time.[/A]
The inheritance plan has been canceled
Are you sure you want to cancel this pending wallet?
This step requires hardware keys to complete.
Health check request has been canceled
All of your assisted wallets are already under lockdown.
A recovery request for this key already exists.
You currently do not have any TAPSIGNER added.
Recurring payments allow you to automatically create transactions that send bitcoins to a predefined destination wallet or addresses at scheduled intervals.
Would you like to customize the account used for this key? Using a new account per wallet helps prevent key reuse and improve privacy.
For maximum security, keep your keys geographically distributed.
New account data needed. Please use the desktop app to connect your device so that the new account can be loaded.
A master account and secondary account(s) control three keys; Nunchuk holds the fourth key.
The keyholder can now continue with the key recovery process on their device.
For security, the key recovery request needs to be approved by at least another keyholder. Please resume once the request has been approved.
Please enter the amount for the payment.
Please specify the destination for the payment.
The recurring payment will be sent to the first available (unused) addresses in the wallet. To set the destination wallet, import the wallet configuration for that wallet.
The recurring payment will automatically rotate among the whitelisted addresses.
The percentage will be calculated based on the wallet balance on the day of the payment.
The percentage will be calculated based on the daily average of the wallet balance over the previous period.
To include multiple addresses, separate them by line-breaks.
Please set the frequency of the payment.
The recurring payment will only require 1 signature from any keyholder.
Don’t allow platform key to co-sign
The recurring payment will require 2 signatures from the keyholders.
The recurring payment will require 3 signatures from the keyholders.
Would you like to add a transaction note for this recurring payment?
Typically allow the payment to be confirmed in 1 block. Recommended if the payment is of time-sensitive nature or must be reliably settled at the earliest.
Typically allow the payment to be confirmed in 2 blocks.

Typically allow the payment to be confirmed in 3 blocks or more. Maximum fee savings. However when fees spike it could take much longer and the payment might subsequently need to be fee-bumped and signed again.
Please select the fee rate for the recurring payment.
This recurring payment enables the platform key to automatically co-sign. Only 1 signature (from any keyholder) is required for each payment.
This recurring payment enables the platform key to automatically co-sign. Two signatures (from any keyholder) is required for each payment.
The recurring payment has been approved
Are you sure you want to cancel this recurring payment?
Are you sure you want to cancel pending cancellation of recurring payments?
Continue to cancel the recurring payment %1$s.
To change the email address associated with the account
Destination cannot be the same wallet.
Please note that the date that you’ve chosen for the start date might not repeat for the cycle selected.
* The percentage will be calculated based on the daily average of the wallet balance over the previous period.
* The percentage will be calculated based on the wallet balance on the day of the payment.
Are you sure you want to deny this recurring payment?
Payments will be sent to the first available addresses in the wallet.
The end date should be after the start date.
Email address change has been canceled.
Set up reminders to health check your keys.
How often would you like to health check these keys?
How often would you like to health check this key?
Select which keys you want to set up reminders for.
The keys have set periodic reminders
The account imported does not match the account that you entered (%1$d). Please try again.
New account data needed. Please import your key again using the given account.
A master account and secondary account(s) control four keys; Nunchuk holds the fifth key on a secure server to assist in inheritance planning and daily wallet operation.
A master account and secondary account(s) control four keys; Nunchuk holds the fifth key on a secure server to assist in daily wallet operation.
The security questions and answers will be updated.
It’s time to check the health of [A]%1$s[/A].
Having two or more software keys on the same device significantly reduces the security of your wallet.
Are you sure you want to do this?
I’ll choose another type of key
New account data needed. To add a new account, please use the original device that the software key was created on.
The software key (%1$s) was upgraded to a hardware key from another device. Do you want to remove the software key from this device?

If a key in an assisted wallet is lost or has been compromised, you can replace it here.\n\nNote that replacing a key with a new one will create a brand new assisted wallet. You will need to transfer the existing balance over to the new wallet afterwards.
Continue to create a new wallet
Which key would you like to replace?
Please use the desktop app to add this key.
[B]Replacing the inheritance key means that you will have to set up the inheritance plan again[/B]. Are you sure you want to do this?
Are you sure you want to cancel the key replacement?
Would you like to transfer all funds from the old wallet to the new wallet?
We will now transfer all funds from the old wallet to %1$s.
Upon completion of the roll-over process, keys that are associated with your old assisted wallet and are no longer used will automatically be removed.
Are you sure you want to cancel the key repalcement?
Replace keys in an assisted wallet
This wallet has been deactivated and replaced by [B]%1$s[/B]. Please don’t use it. It’s only here for your records.
For security, please note that a decrease in the co-signing delay will only become effective after an amount of time equal to the current delay has passed.
What type of personal wallet do you want to create?
